function_call.name: classify_risks_framework
function_call.arguments: {"sorted_risks":[{"name":"Overreliance on p-values to determine the influence of environmental variables on influenza seasonality","category":"Health","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Multicollinearity in regression model","category":"Tools&Apps","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Spread of contagious diseases through respiratory aerosols and surfactants","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Use of statistical models for virus viability analysis may lead to inaccurate predictions and conclusions.","category":"Health","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Misinterpretation of the relationship between rh and absolute humidity ah could lead to errors in humidity control measures and disease transmission mitigation strategies.","category":"Health","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Difficulty in quantitatively comparing the relative contribution of airborne transmission with other transmission modes","category":"Health","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Spread of infective diseases between the population","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Misuse of downloaded content","category":"Security","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Lack of experience in workshop attendees","category":"Education","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Reliance on internet-based technologies for data collection","category":"Tools&Apps","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Visiting ugss close to homes with family or friends","category":"Living","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Perception of urban green spaces shifted during the covid-19 pandemic, leading to changes in visitor behavior and usage.","category":"Living","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Visiting parks on weekends and weekdays without a preference may lead to crowded spaces, increasing the risk of disease transmission.","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Majority of respondents visited parks alone during the confinement, contradicting the recommended social gathering guidelines.","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Visitors’ tendency to wander through the space rather than staying in one place during the confinement may result in increased interactions and overlapping of individuals, elevating disease transmission risk.","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Online surveys may create a methodological bias by excluding individuals with limited internet access and computer skills.","category":"Health","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Decrease in in-person surveys during the confinement may lead to a loss of data from individuals who are unable to participate in online surveys.","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Changes in respondents’ occupations and demographic characteristics during the confinement period may impact the comparability of survey data before and during the confinement.","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Variable associations detected through correspondence analysis","category":"Tools&Apps","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Inverse relationship between population density and ugs density","category":"Health","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Conducting surveys with 298 participants during a pandemic may increase the risk of disease transmission.","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Mandatory in-person data collection for section b of the survey increases the risk of disease transmission.","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Use of f test and statistical analysis may not account for the impact of the pandemic on survey responses.","category":"Health","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Collection of data from iphone users without explicit consent","category":"Security","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Comparison of profiles before and during confinement","category":"Health","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Public gatherings in parks","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Population density in urban green spaces","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"People’s mobility during confinement","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Shift in the use of ugss as places for shelter, amusement, and social gathering due to covid-19 pandemic","category":"Living","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Notable increase in the use of nature-related cell-phone applications, such as birdwatching apps","category":"Living","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Conducting face-to-face surveys during a pandemic","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of access to green spaces during a pandemic","category":"Living","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Confinement conditions impact perception and willingness to pay for green areas.","category":"Living","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Impact of covid-19 on perception of green spaces","category":"Living","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inconsistency in drivers for wtp for green roofs","category":"Wealth production","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Comparing both models, the only two variables in common are the number of inhabitants under 12 and the relative contribution to the household income.","category":"Wealth Distribution","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"It is interesting to notice how the wtp for a large green roof in portugal builds up on the wtp for a smaller one and the availability to pay more for a larger one.","category":"Wealth Distribution","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Multinomial logistic regression model developed due to violation of proportional odds statistically significant effects of green space awareness and availability on wtp","category":"Wealth Distribution","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Widespread knowledge of green roofs","category":"Wealth Distribution","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Majority of respondents living in properties with 2-4 bedrooms, with a significant percentage being property owners.","category":"Wealth Distribution","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Survey respondents from multiple countries","category":"Culture/Diversity","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Large percentage of women and men in the survey","category":"Culture/Diversity","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Households with children under 12 years old","category":"Health","confidence":"High"}]}
